title: Introduction to CASCAM package
text: data preparation step, following data necessary – tumor_log_tpm: data set tumor gene expression log scale (log2-TPM preferred). highly recommend merge interested tumor samples pan-cancer dataset (TCGA) benefit large sample size, shown outperformance comparing small sample size. tumor_label: vector sample labels tumor log tpm data (binary class, interested v.s. uninterested). camod_log_tpm: data set cancer model gene expression log scale (log2-TPM preferred). Similarly, better performance can also come larger sample size. tumor_ct: data set un-normalized (estimated) counts sequencing reads fragments tumor data. tumor_label2: vector sample labels tumor count data (binary class, interested v.s. uninterested).

title: Introduction to CASCAM package
text: Celligner applied framework allow tumors cancer models directly comparable. Users can refer paper information. simplify process, use default parameters setting Celligner paper. step may take time (~ 30 min). Celligner returns Seurat object aligned data included, aligned data tumor cancer models interest (tumor_aligned camod_aligned) can extracted.

title: Introduction to CASCAM package
text: Informative genes detected using tumor count matrix. DESeq2 fgsea implied framework identify differential expression genes enriched pathways (Hallmark KEGG).

title: Introduction to CASCAM package
text: CASCAM created downstream analysis.

title: Introduction to CASCAM package
text: first step section train SDA model (1) high dimensionality; (2) data sparsity; (3) classification assignment probabilities. default, 1/20 genes selected model, L2-norm parameter pre-set 1e-4. Users can provide choics train model cross-validation. Parallel computation available cross-validation function. Starting , users can store CASCAM_eg object RData file call run_CASCAM_app() interactive exploration. next step calculate genome-related measurements. Users can use SDA projected positions CASCAM_eg@genome_figure$sda_project_position confidence intervals CASCAM_eg@genome_figure$sda_ds_ci_rank evaluate cancer models visually.
code: CASCAM_eg <- sda_model(CASCAM_eg) CASCAM_eg <- sda_model_cv(CASCAM_eg) CASCAM_eg <- genome_selection(CASCAM_eg) CASCAM_eg <- genome_selection_visualize(CASCAM_eg)

title: Introduction to CASCAM package
text: Pathway specific exploration performed based genome-wide pre-selected cancer models. Pathway-related measurements first calculated. downstream exploration goes follows – pathway_congruence_heatmap: Explore performance selected cancer models across available pathways using pathway congruence heatmap. pathway_specific_heatmap: Select interested pathway analyze performance selected cancer models across genes within pathway using pathway specific heatmap. pathway_specific_ridgeline: Determine subset selected cancer models visualize positions gene within pathway using pathway specific ridgeline . pathview_analysis: Choose one cancer model visualize topological structure final decision (pathway KEGG) using pathview. highly recommended performance exploration using Shiny app provides better experience iterative exploration.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jian Zou. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zou J (2022). CASCAM: Congruence Analysis Selector Cancer Models. R package version 0.1.0, https://jianzou75.github.io/CASCAM/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {CASCAM: Congruence Analysis and Selector of Cancer Models},   author = {Jian Zou},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://jianzou75.github.io/CASCAM/}, }

what: CASCAM (Congruence Analysis and Selector of CAncer Models)
title: Congruence Analysis and Selector of Cancer Models
text: CASCAM R package analyzing selecting appropriate cancer models (cell lines, PDOs PDXs) based patients’ tumor information. figure shows framework method. Several statistics defined measure distance tumor samples cancer models.  help CASCAM, users can: Identify genome-wide appropriate cancer models visually statistically. Evaluate genome-wide pre-selected cancer models different pathways. Explore similarity tumor samples cancer model pathway topology level. Use mentioned tools R Shiny app interactively. complete package documentation instruction can found .

previous_headings: CASCAM (Congruence Analysis and Selector of CAncer Models)
title: Congruence Analysis and Selector of Cancer Models
text: package can downloaded installed GitHub. package installed successfully, needed ensure dependency packages installed. package based R (>= 4.0.5), R code installing dependent packages :
code: install.packages('devtools') devtools::install_github('jianzou75/CASCAM') ## from CRAN CRAN.packages <- function(pkg){     new.pkg <- pkg[!(pkg %in% installed.packages()[, "Package"])]     if (length(new.pkg))          install.packages(new.pkg, dependencies = TRUE) } CRAN.packages(c("sparseLDA", "doParallel", "boot", "caret", "magrittr",                 "ggplot2", "ggrepel", "patchwork", "dplyr", "ggridges",                 "reshape2", "grid", "png", "ggplotify", "Seurat", "mclust",                 "shinythemes", "shiny"))  ## from Bioconductor Bioconductor.packages <- function(pkg){     new.pkg <- pkg[!(pkg %in% installed.packages()[, "Package"])]     if (length(new.pkg))          BiocManager::install(new.pkg, dependencies = TRUE) } Bioconductor.packages(c("pathview", "DESeq2", "fgsea", "qusage"))

title: The CASCAM class — CASCAM-class
text: CASCAM class

title: The CASCAM class — CASCAM-class
text: tumor_aligned_data data frame aligned tumor gene expression rows genes columns samples. tumor_label vector strings indicating labels tumor samples. camod_aligned_data data.frame aligned cancer model gene expression rows genes columns samples. sda_model list SDA model trained tumor data. tumor_norm_data data frame normalized tumor_aligned_data rows samples columns genes. camod_norm_data data frame normalized camod_aligned_data rows samples columns genes. tumor_sda_project one column matrix showing SDA projected vector tumor gene expression. camod_sda_project one column matrix showing SDA projected vector cancer model gene expression. sda_ds data frame SDA deviance score rows camods columns tumor subtypes. sda_lds data frame SDA log deviance score rows camods columns tumor subtypes. sda_predict_prob two column matrix showing SDA assignment probabilities camods. sda_ds_pval two column matrix showing p-values SDA deviance scores camods. sda_lds_ci list two matrices showing 95% confidence intervals sda_lds. genome_figure list two ggplot2 figures genome-wide pre-selection (distribution confidence interval). selected_camods vector genome-wide selected cancer models representing interested tumor subtype sda_predict_prob sda_ds_pval. gene_ds list two matrices showing gene-specific deviance score. pathway_ds list two matrices showing pathway-specific deviance score. available_pathways vector available pathways. pathway_congruence_heatmap ggplot2 object pathway congruence heatmap. pathway_gene_heatmap ggplot2 object pathway specific heatmap. pathway_gene_ridgeline ggplot2 object pathway specific gene expression ridgeline. pathview_figure pathview figure one specific pathway one specific cancer model.

what: Celligner: tumor and cell line model normalized RNASeq data alignment — Celligner
title: Celligner: tumor and cell line model normalized RNASeq data alignment — Celligner
text: two-step machine learning method make normalized RNASeq data (log2 TPM preferred) cell lines tumors comparable. gain benefits large sample size, recommended merge interested tumor samples public datasets TCGA. parameters set default consistent Celligner paper, users can refer origional paper details.

title: Celligner: tumor and cell line model normalized RNASeq data alignment — Celligner
Celligner: tumor and cell line model normalized RNASeq data alignment — Celligner
text: tumor matrix data frame normalized tumor gene expression log scale (log2-TPM preferred) rows genes columns samples. cell matrix data frame normalized cell line gene expression log scale (log2-TPM preferred) rows genes columns samples.

title: Celligner: tumor and cell line model normalized RNASeq data alignment — Celligner
text: Seurat object aligned data included. Seurat::GetAssayData() can used extract aligned dataset.

title: Celligner: tumor and cell line model normalized RNASeq data alignment — Celligner
text: Warren, Allison, Yejia Chen, Andrew Jones, Tsukasa Shibue, William C. Hahn, Jesse S. Boehm, Francisca Vazquez, Aviad Tsherniak, James M. McFarland. 2021. “Global Computational Alignment Tumor Cell Line Transcriptional Profiles.” Nature Communications 12 (1): 22. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-020-20294-x.
